main event: Various witnesses reported seeing a bright object in the sky over El Paso, Texas on May 28, 1950, which appeared to break into two pieces and then reunite before falling towards the Earth.
interesting points: Witnesses described the object as having a bright trail and compared its size to that of a pea or dime at arm's length., The object was seen traveling at a steep angle and was visible for only a few seconds., Observations were made from different viewpoints including control tower operators and civilians., Witnesses noted the object's bright colors such as reddish-white and orange., There were multiple witnesses including air force personnel and local residents.
sighted object: one bright object with a trail
witness description: control tower operators and local residents
